website_summaries.verdict: A classic, go-to utility knife with a good-sized, sturdy handle that is easy to grip while cutting.
pros: Sturdy handle and blades thick enough to handle tougher cutting jobs
Fast, easy, and safe to open and retract blade
cons: No instructions for assembly, which can be a little confusing the first time

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 3; 2 worked fine, but one defective--and couldn't return it.
customer_reviews.text: Says item not eligible for a return -- but it's defective, and there's no option to get my money back. I ordered three of these, and the other two worked fine, but the third one isn't safe to use. . . it's very resistant to being "opened" (having the blade pushed out), and once it's out all the way, the blade won't go back in. I almost cut myself, multiple times, just trying to get the blade to go back. And then I couldn't get the knife open to try to fix it. Definitely a problem. Would be okay if I could return it, or get a replacement, but apparently that's not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knife works but the assembly screw was cross threaded!
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived with the assembly screw cross threaded! I was sick! Fortunately, I had a set of mini files and was able to clean the screw threads up enough to get a die started. I had to re-thread the screw to get it to work but it works fine now. Just greatly disappointed in Stanley! Not everyone has the tools to repair another tool, and it should not be necessary! Quality Control must have been asleep the day this one was built!
customer_reviews.author: Ballsar Frozenoff

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of junk unlike Stanlsy products of the past.
customer_reviews.text: The screw that has to be removed to insert a blade is difficult to unscrew. The blade is very difficult to insert and the two halves of the tool are very difficult to align to allow the screw to be inserted and tightened. Get it too tight and the blade cannot be pushed out to use. DO NOT ORDER ONE OF THESE BOX CUTTERS. To add insult to injury, it cannot be returned, which is not made apparent until the information has been written about the problems of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin

customer_reviews.title: Does America even know how to make good product and Make America Great Again?
customer_reviews.text: I bought Stanley box cuter paying higher price for its brand name but when I received this knife, I had hard time to unscrew the screw to install the blade. The screw was out of alignment between top and bottom cover. Then I read the label again and found it was "MADE IN USA". I was shock to find for such a simple product, it must got out of factory without even going through some basic test. And there must be no Quality Control procedure installed in the manufacturing process. I ,myself, for one will never buy Stan;ey products anymore.. And I urge everyone should check your merchandise before open it.
customer_reviews.author: Shenobi408

customer_reviews.title: This cuts like a hot knife through butter!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed! I had this cheapy "safety" box cutter that was never awesomely sharp and lately I've needed to cut down cardboard boxes and it was a struggle so: "Amazon to the rescue"! Price: $3.88 Pros: arrived quickly; is very sturdy; fits my hand nicely (ergo) Cons: upon receipt you need to open it up to get to the blade inside. It was a struggle to get it open but afterwards it screwed in and out easily... it was like the screw may have been crooked originally. Would definitely buy again! This makes quick work of cutting up cardboard! My only regret? That I didn't buy 1 for every toolbox!
customer_reviews.author: Techgeek

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: can never use this knife. the screw is completed dead locked in, unable to open the shaft and put the blade in. surprised to find out this is a nonreturnable item. waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t take it apart to install blade
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and had no qualms about it not working, after all this is your basic trusty Stanley boxcutter that hasn’t changed in how many years.... although it has. I couldn’t remove a simple screw to open it up and install the blade. The screw is low quality and ended up being stripped after I struggled to unscrew it. I ended up throwing the whole thing away🙁.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: annoying
customer_reviews.text: A box cutter is a good quality razor blade and a handle. This cutter comes with paper in place of the razor blade. So it has to be opened. Which then requires lining up a new blade, and putting in a screw all of which involves loose pieces. Nothing has good guides to fit together. At best you lose 10 minutes for nothing at worst you end up losing or breaking a piece. I've never had a box cutter that didn't work from ones that were $1 or to $20. Worst of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Bolden

customer_reviews.title: Loser.
customer_reviews.text: You must unscrew the device to get at the blades and to change them. However, the screw and the threads don't match and you have to use lots of force to unscrew it. You must be careful not to strip the screw or you will never get it out. It has both Phillips and flat screw slots. I worked very carefully with a flat bladed screwdriver because the pressure it took to open it would have just rounded the Phillips grooves. After forcefully closing it I don't look forward to changing the blade. BTW, there is only one spare so you should order more blades.
customer_reviews.author: wyzowl

customer_reviews.title: Good Knife, But Not Like They Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a classic form that is great for general use around my workbench. I prefer the quick change knives for any job away from my workbench when I just want an uncomplicated blade change, but I like how solid and simple this classic look is. That said, this version is definitely not made the same as it used to be. The difference is subtle, but noticeable when I compared it to my knife that I bought 20 years ago. Don’t not buy this knife, but bear in mind that it isn’t quite as nice as it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: My first purchase of knife
customer_reviews.text: First time I ever bought one of these. Took me a long time to figure how to operate. For other first-timers, try the following. 1) unscrew the large screw, do not touch the cardboard. 2) Gently place one side of knife to ur right. 3) Remove the cardboard. 4) Note carefully placement of blade. 5) Return top side of opener and screw back on. 6) If blade does not move easily up and down, loosen the screw. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: IMLee-221B Baker St

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Smoothly
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of opening boxes like a heathen (yanking tape off, pulling cardboard apart, loud noises - I’ve got an infant in the house now) so I bought this box cutter. When you first unscrew this, it’s easy to miss the blades because they blend in with the box cutter color but rest assured, they are there. I like that it holds backup blades inside it because I wouldn’t want extra blades just hanging out in my junk drawer. Gets the job done, cuts smoothly, no complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie M.

customer_reviews.title: Total junk.
customer_reviews.text: I now understand what happened to the Stanley works. All 3 of these tools have components that are slightly off in size. If you can get the screw out - need a large P2 screwdriver. Once open you find the slider is just too small for the blade, locks up if you put it together. It only goes back together if you jam the blade into the slider. if this really made-in-the-USA, we are seriously in trouble. Overall total junk.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Garlans

customer_reviews.title: Requires the skill of a mechanical genius or rubic cube specialist to get it working
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours trying to get it properly working, and it took a mechanical friend about 30 mins. and much frustration. I'm aware that Stanley is a revered name in tools, but the lack of proper and very tiny illustration is hard to justify. The management should start thinking of customers who are not trained mechanics. This device does what it is supposed to do, but I almost sent it back for a refund. I wonder if I'm the only "stupid" member of the public who feels as I do.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Carl

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality overall
customer_reviews.text: You have to take the knife apart to remove the packaging cardboard. The screw apparently comes cross-threaded so it is difficult or impossible to remove. The tab that pushes the blade out for use and retracts it is very flimsy and when I was putting the one I could get apart back together it snapped off clean with no real pressure being directly applied to it. I'm keeping the blades and throwing these away. Apparently the Stanley name does not mean quality any more. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How stupid we can be.
customer_reviews.text: Sick of it! I am so tired of multi-lock bottles, containers, serving bottles, all of it where you buy something and you can't even access it. If I used my head and read the goofy instruction manual I wouldn't have bought it, ended up throwing it away, my bad. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Installation required
customer_reviews.text: Had same brand box cutter growing up and when I bought my house I thought this would be useful. Installation is required. You need screwdriver to unscrew the cutter and it comes with 2 blades. I wish it had serrated edge to break off when blade becomes dull. Kinda hard to line up and install blade but I figured it out. It has Safety push mechanism to slide blade up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Itliong Fechter

customer_reviews.title: WORST BOX KNIFE MADE
customer_reviews.text: Awful maddening piece of crap! Just like some other one star reviews mention....beware opening it to change the blade because everything will fall out and then it becomes a monkey puzzle tree to reassemble! I HATE IT! No directions on how to get it back together and once you do get it to close back up with the new blade you aren't exactly sure what you did to do it!!!! BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Ross

customer_reviews.title: Hard Hard hard to open the cutter to set the blade............
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible to unscrew the main screw to open the cutter, almost impossible. Finally did and it works fine but putting it back together the screw bound up the last 3 turns and was almost impossible to get in the last couple of turns. Someone is going to gouge themselves when the screwdriver they are using to open the cutter slips and goes thru their other wrist or hand. BE CAREFUL !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: The razors are shipped to you enclosed in the body of the retractable knife by a single screw. That screw was stripped and I have been unable to open it to get the razors out. Apparently it is ineligible for return, so I am stuck with a worthless $5 box cutter. Do not waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: km4000

customer_reviews.title: A Garbage Utility Knife
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. Did I say poorly made? I needed a jackhammer to unscrew the knife to put in the blade. Once you put in the blade the two sides of the knife do not match up. That would explain why it was nigh impossible to unscrew it in the first place. I am so frustrated that I will NEVER buy anything made by STANLEY ever again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Eike

customer_reviews.title: Stanley Classic 99
customer_reviews.text: If it ain't broke don't fix it. With all the new easy this and quick that knives out there this is still my go to utility knife. So you have to take off a screw to change the blade. It's not a hard thing to do and at least I know this thing is reliable unlike most of the other fancy ones I've tried. I bought these as a replacement for misplaced and lost ones. I have not yet had to replace a broken one.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to open the phillips screw
customer_reviews.text: I am still struggling with the screw, using a straight screw driver after starting with a phillips. I am afraid of stripping it. I have already gouged my hand when the screwdriver slipped. I am good at unscrewing things, reasonably strong. This seems glued on, was likely machine screwed in, and tougher to open than it needs to be for the average user who will be opening it, necessarily, all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Orwellflash

customer_reviews.title: Good knife, difficult to open
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous knife, but the screw that needs to be removed was so tight, I had to hold either end with my booted feet, pressing down on the screwdriver, and it still took 10 minutes. Also no instructions came with it, so unless you already know you need to unscrew it you'd probably have to look up how to set the blade online. Otherwise it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for boxes
customer_reviews.text: I keep this utility knife near where I open my boxes and it makes breaking them down a breeze. The blade is thin and sharp so it cuts through packing tape better than scissors. Each blade is double-sided, and it comes with a replacement blade so you will get months to years of use out of this knife. The knife is easy to hold, and it doesn't feel flimsy like plastic utility knifes.
customer_reviews.author: RobPlease

customer_reviews.title: Works well for light projects
customer_reviews.text: Very effective for my needs. Mostly opening boxes (duh!) and other packaging. Kind of cheap/chintzy feeling but works fine. Putting it together was a little strand. The simple mechanism inside is just loose and you ultimately secure the blade with the external "jacket" and the screw, so it's a bit of a balancing act getting the blade into the (loose) mechanism and getting it aligned just right. Again, works fine. Just a little cheap/light feeling. I did already order a second one for our utility room downstairs and had the same "struggles" (minimal) with initial assembly. But once it's together works just fine. Will not be happy when I have to replace blade though. Overall, probably worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa J Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but uncomfortable sliding mechanism
customer_reviews.text: It feels sturdy and strong, very good grip. But alodong mechanism isn't reliable. It has a center screw to open and close the tool and replace blades. If that screw is correctly pressed, it's very hard to slide the blade open as if the screw pressed both tool's halves in excess. Loosing the screw eases the slide but blade lock stop working and the blade easily retracts when pressing the tool. I had better expectations for this cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Sebas

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME--
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a real piece of crap! I worked with it for over an hour trying to get it together- then my husband took over- no luck there, my neighbor and his son who is in construction- still no luck------- Update-- I purchased one at the hardware store- there is a spring that comes with this- mine was missing.
customer_reviews.author: watchinoutforusall

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but . . .
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely cannot get the cutter open. I don't know who on earth put it together but it is impossible to open with a screw driver. Not worth returning but VERY dissatisfied with it. I should have looked at the review that mentioned it also. What a waste of money and time that I put it trying to get it to work!
customer_reviews.author: JoEri

customer_reviews.title: quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: I've used this style knife before, and they're generally great. The particular item I received had the screw cross-threaded with metal from the body permanently embedded between the screw threads. It still screws and unscrews but it takes a LOT of force, and this defect will destroy the threading on the body over time.
customer_reviews.author: fireflystars

customer_reviews.title: Okay cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is a low price cutter that accepts disposable blades. It is decent, but alas less quality than my old Companion cutter which was a downgraded Craftsman. The slide is cheap and may or may not last. But it did come with extra blades so that is a plus. For the price it's a good buy for a general purpose utility knife.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Good job, Stanley!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an add-on item to replace a lost/missing box cutter here at home. The one they sent me had a stripped/stuck screw, so I was unable to open the case to remove the packaging and place in the blades. They sent me a replacement one, free of charge. The second cutter works great! No problems, very sturdy, wonderful heavy-duty all purpose utility knife. I love Stanley products. Good job, folks!
customer_reviews.author: valeri

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, needs instructions
customer_reviews.text: Sharp utility knife and cuts straight along the markings. Comes with 3 blades so should last for a while since they can be changed when one dulls. It did not come with instructions however and took some time to figure out how to attach the blades to the knife which were actually hiding in between the 2 parts of the handle and had to be unscrewed in order to be retrieved. I would have appreciated some directions. So don't return it, if when you open it, you think that it's a broken product. Just look online - I'm sure someone has printed or visual instructions somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: booksonline18

customer_reviews.title: You've tried others...now try the best.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like these box cutters just get up and walk away....especially if you open a lot of cardboard boxes like I do. They may not be the prettiest ones out there....yet they do the job. I bought 2 this time and now I have one in 3 different places. They give you 3 blades in the package...one to use and 2 for spares. I also bought an add on from Amazon for a 5 pk. of spare blades.....now I am all set. Bring on the cardboard boxes. I highly recommend these Stanley Retractable box cutters for anyone who needs to cut open packages. You will not be disappointed with the sturdiness and the great cutting ability.
customer_reviews.author: T. Malley

customer_reviews.title: Very good box cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very heavy duty box cutter and I've purchased this once before, but had to get it again when I lost the first one. It is very heavy and wouldn't break, you wouldn't have to worry about the blade falling out. It comes with two blades, and you'll have to unscrew and take it apart to access/switch it out. The blade extension is good and it's very comfortable to use. Cuts great as well.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Simple and well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made and good value for this utility knife. Note: before 1st use, the retractable mechanism must be adjusted by the user so that the blade stays in the selected retraction position. Basically, just bend it so that it's more secure and doesn't accidentally slip back.
customer_reviews.author: M.T.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and does the job well
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to figure out how to use it. You need to unscrew the knife, take one blade out carefully, put it in the assigned position and screw in again. But it cuts very well, fits well in my hand, comfortable to use and very convenient. I wish the push button was a bit easier to press and slide, but I think it's the safety feature when you have children in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Tram

customer_reviews.title: This one is a little rough
customer_reviews.text: Very similar to the one my father had years ago when Stanley was a proud New England company. This one is a little rough and does not fit together smoothly. It does work, but hits bumps as you slide the blade in and out. The blades are very sharp, so cutting should be no problem.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool.
customer_reviews.text: Stanley quality - made in USA with sourced parts ( foreign ?). Comes with 3 blades, stored in handle. You must put 1’st blade in to use, easy to do. Easy slide mechanism. Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and SHARP
customer_reviews.text: You must be careful with this, it's very sharp but is just what I needed for cutting up boxes into smaller pieces for the trash. I cut up over 20 boxes yesterday and it's still as sharp as when I started. Made quick work of a dreaded task.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Snow

customer_reviews.title: For those who just want to cut stuff and then make the blade disappear
customer_reviews.text: No, it doesn't look like an Autobot or a Decepticon which definitely decreases its cool factor but when you slide the blade out you can cut stuff, which is kinda' what the whole idea it. When you retract the blade, it's gone. Replacing the blade does require to you unscrew a single screw which is a damnable feature according to all the fancy knives that offer push-button releases, etc. But in my experience those fancy push-button blade release knives either break or let go of the blade when I really get down to using the thing. This knife, in all its simplicity, does exactly what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Blade Won't Slide
customer_reviews.text: When I seat the two halves of the handle together and tighten the screw, the blade will not slide. When I loosen the screw and the halves are loosely fitted, the blade slides, but it's not safe to use the cutter like this. Surprised and disappointed. I think Stanley should do (much) better than this!!!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Old school classic box cutter
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Stanley utility knives for 60-years — anytime I wish to avoid dulling my good pocket knife. This was advertised as including three blades. But it arrived without any blades. So be certain to add a pack of replacement blades if you decide to order it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Benner - Fearless Intelligence

customer_reviews.title: I would be embarassed to promote this as "American Made" since it's so rickety.
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly precision made. The parts sort of fit with the slide rattling (I am not talking about the extra blades) and moving around and the finish is sloppy. Not at all the quality I would expect from "American Made". If you cannot make a good tool at this price - charge more but make something to be proud of. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gorman

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: This item does not work! You need to take it apart to build it and the pieces do not fit together. I also got a deep wound on my hand attempting to assemble this knife, though I was extremely careful. Also it is not possible to return it if you buy it here, I've tried. Dont waste your time or money!
customer_reviews.author: JennyMac

customer_reviews.title: Where's the Blade?
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. Just received this item and realized it came sans blade. Why bother?
customer_reviews.author: Abbeylaca

customer_reviews.title: Good function but feels cheapish
customer_reviews.text: This box cutter works well (opening mostly Amazon packages), but something in it (maybe a spare blade?) rattles around and makes it feel as if it's going to fall apart at any moment. Definitely lighter weight than a previous Stanley box cutter that it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: S. LaCour

customer_reviews.title: kinda funky at first
customer_reviews.text: Swapping blades for the first time took me way longer than I want to admit. After the third swap I had it down pat, you have to pull the slide all the way back in order for the screw hole to align properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Tilman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and not worth ir
customer_reviews.text: Simple and useful. I should have gotten one of these a long time ago. I use it to open my amazon boxes and whatever else around the house I may need it for. Update: it’s cheaply made. I literally got a metal splinter in my finger the other day while retracting the blade! The blades loosely wiggle around inside the holder. I threw it away. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: claire

customer_reviews.title: Stanley tools don’t disappoint. Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Stanley tools don’t disappoint I love this tool. Reminds me of my grand fathers cutting tool. Well made and durable. Easy to replace cutting blades can hold up to six or seven extra blades. Can’t live without them. You should have at least one pair in your tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Terry McAdams

customer_reviews.title: Lost & Found
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Stanley after misplacing my 20-year-old Irwin cutter. (Sadly, Irwin has recently been bought out by Stanley Black & Decker.) No instructions. Fortunately I found the old Irwin and so I saved the Stanley blades and tossed out the shoddy cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Rhetorician

customer_reviews.title: STANLEY CLASSIC RETRACTABLE UTILITY KNIFE
customer_reviews.text: This is made by the Stanley Company; a company that has a reputation of making & selling high quality hand tools. You will be hard pressed to find hand tools that are as good as Stanley yet within a reasonable price the average consumer can afford. This is my 2nd purchase of this type of knife, both are made by Stanley & will last many years. Basically I put my Stanley knives through *cough, cough* and have yet to ever have a problem with them. They are very well made, very cost effective, & most importantly, very easy to use. I highly recommend this knife & any other hand tools made by Stanley.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I use it to cut the boxes that I put in the recycler bin. It came with three blades. What I like about this product is that when ever a blade gets dull, you just open it and flip the blade. Even though you get three blades, technically it's six. I tested it on several boxes and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA and prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: Now I have a sturdy knife to help me break down all those Amazon boxes for recycling. This is the classic, heavy duty utility knife, made in the USA of globally source materials. Reasonably priced and brought right to my front door.
customer_reviews.author: Rosey

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Horrible instructions on how to install the blade. The Stanley Company should rewrite the instructions that are now on the utility knife packet label because they do not depict reliable instruction steps. I had to go to YouTube to find out how to put the blade in the knife & I’m pretty good at assembling products.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and a Bargain
customer_reviews.text: What's not to say, it's Stanley and it's one of the best brands on the market. I work in a warehouse and have been using this for 4 months now with no issues. The refill blades range from $1.50 to $3.00 a pack at Home Depot depending on the quantity you buy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required
customer_reviews.text: Was not expecting to have to assemble this and had a lot of trouble installing the blade. The ones you buy at Home Depot and Lowe’s come fully assembled. Nice item once it’s assembled.
customer_reviews.author: D. Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Quality Varies Widely
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these, and it works great ... heavy duty and well made. Then I ordered two more, and was very disappointed. The central screw on one is so badly cross threaded that it's (almost) impossible to remove. The internal tabs on the other are misaligned so it can't be easily assembled, and after I manage to get it together, the blade doesn't easily slide ... it's usable, but barely. Beware: Amazon says these aren't eligible for returns ... even if they are clearly defective?!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: she's fine for the price
customer_reviews.text: she's fine for the price, comes with extra blades. But I have had one or two bend/break on me even when I'm cutting a cardboard box open (???) it's also a bit of a puzzle to replace the blade Really I think if I just buy sturdier replacement blades it'll fix my biggest problem, so I'd recommend this product for the around the house box cutting, but not for heavy use construction.
customer_reviews.author: Ax

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Good quality knife. When you get it, the blades are inside of it so you need a small screwdriver to open it up. It’s very simple metal design makes it very handy. Would greatly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carrigg

customer_reviews.title: Total crap and YOU CAN'T RETURN IT!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 6 of these. 1 was covered in some kind of tarry crap. 1 I couldn't open because the threads were stripped. Another I put the blade in properly but after reassembly it won't click. Unfortunately, I ordered 6 of them. I tried to return them and YOU CAN'T RETURN THEM TO AMAZON! You have to go to the manufacturer for that. This is the second time in a week this has happened, it must be a new policy for Amazon and I don't like it one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hargraves

customer_reviews.title: It's a Stanley. Good for cutting tape on boxes. Utility blades came with utility knife.
customer_reviews.text: This product seems just what I ordered. Came on time. Simple to order. Had 4 blades with it. Easy to set up blades. Since utility blades are sharp and cut well, this Stanley Classic Retractable Utility knife seems perfect. I gave it 4 stars because I haven't used it for its purchased reason yet, cutting boxes.
customer_reviews.author: David Schaedler

customer_reviews.title: SCAM
customer_reviews.text: It came defective and you can’t return. How convenient, if you like to give away your money this is the purchase for you
customer_reviews.author: nicolette

customer_reviews.title: Only Half Work, Not Returnable
customer_reviews.text: Knowing that half of these don't work, I purchased twice as many as I needed. What I didn't know is that these are not returnable! I call BS. Well, I was right. Two of them worked perfectly and two don't work at all. I like these box cutters but in the future I will buy them from a store like Home Depot rather than Amazon so I can return any that don't work. What a rip off!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold and lasts a lot longer than the plastic ones I've ordered in the past. This is the second time I have ordered these as I am replacing ones the plastic ones and I seem to loose them and find them all the time so want to have more so I can find them when I need one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work and has no blade
customer_reviews.text: Does not work has no blade. Tried all kinds of screwdrivers to open it but nail does not come out. Very frustrating. My hands has a couple of cuts trying to unscrew the nail to open it. Want to give no stars. But have to for comment. Waste of $
customer_reviews.author: Akay

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to use.
customer_reviews.text: I took the screw out, and the knife fell all over. I can't get it back together. Just throwing this away, since it's 100% useless.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Prang

customer_reviews.title: Assembled poorly, will not function
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a couple of these before and they worked fine. But this time the parts did not fit together properly. The screw holding it together was not straight so it took some effort to get the thing apart. Then the blade would not fit in the blade mechanism properly so that when it was put back together the blade would not slide out. For some reason there's NO RETURN POLICY. I am stuck with a useless piece of metal.
customer_reviews.author: Xan Cassiel

customer_reviews.title: A perfect, simple, tool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to change blades. The retracing blade is a nice safety feature. With recycling, there are often lots of cardboard boxes to breakdown. This tool makes that easy. It also of course makes short work of cutting packaging tape and opening a box.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff SwitzerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is quite sturdy. I only wish they could cut through cardboard cleanly. Cardboard is an impossible art medium.
customer_reviews.author: L. Emory

customer_reviews.title: Unable to  use blade
customer_reviews.text: Came with a piece of cardboard stuck in the area of knife. I could NOT get it out. Finally I pulled so hard it was torn off. The blade will NOT come out . No instructions, no nothing. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Baker

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying for weeks now to try and get the blade out so that I can actually use this.... the screw to unlock this is so tightly in there that it cannot be undone. We’ve tried with a power tool, I have had friends try... this is utterly and completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mariel

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I have several Stanley box cutters I bought years ago. The quality of these is beyond poor. Trying to get the blade to slide is ridiculously difficult & not worth the hassle. These are going back & will be replaced with a much better box cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Stanley products are usually high quality. I couldn't get this one to work. The insert in the tip would not pull out.so I could free up the blade and start using it. Perhaps I got a bad one but it is too much trouble to return it. Hopefully other people will be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super durable!
customer_reviews.text: Used this utility knife to take out several rooms worth of carpeting. Ergonomic design and user friendly. Definitely would recommend this one if you’re working on a big project and need something that is going to last through the entire job!
customer_reviews.author: Sara B

customer_reviews.title: I love that this model allows you to curry a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality built Retractable razor blade. I love that this model allows you to curry a few extra blades in the handle. it is easy to change out the blades using a screwdriver and once the tool is screwed back together feels very strong. the blades locks in to position and stays locked in the toughest job. Very Happy with this blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because of the Stanley name but I will never buy another Stanley product again. It arrived this AM and my husband and I worked all morning to try to get the screw open . would not turn this knife is useless to me and now I find out it is non returnable.Is this how Stanley makes its profits these days? DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these utility knives! They work better than any others I've tried. In fact, this is my third purchase of the item. I use them for all kinds of things- opening packages, cutting foam core, cutting mat board, etc. I have one upstairs, one downstairs, and one in my kitchen. I use them in my studio also. Don't let the lower price fool you! These things are dependable, long lasting, and easy to use! I've been using them for years.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Classic
customer_reviews.text: After using the newer style "quick change" knife on a remodel project, I realized that although it's nice to be able to pop a blade in and out quickly, it simply couldn't keep up with the heavy duty uses i was coming across. On thick materials like sheetrock, the blade would simply pop right out. That's where the old school Stanley steps in and shows it's mettle. It may be more of a hassle to change the blade, but the solid construction will hold up for the long run and the blade won't pop out on you.
customer_reviews.author: CR4SHED

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get open
customer_reviews.text: I've used these in the past and for some reason this newer model seems to be harder to take apart to change the blades. Not sure why exactly. It also feels a bit heavier than the ones I've had previously. Still works great otherwise though.
customer_reviews.author: Terra Tsuji

customer_reviews.title: um the blades are inside...
customer_reviews.text: ok blonde moment. i was so excited when these arrived because i knew that they would help make the moving process easier. but when i opened them, there was no blade! i was so mad at myself for not reading the description better. so i took them to home depot to buy blades. thankfully, a wonderful home depot man just chuckled, got out a screwdriver and revealed 3 healthy little blades stored inside. now that i know how to use it... it's great! serves it purpose, it's sturdy, easy to use. used it for rope, boxes, tape, etc.
customer_reviews.author: atx_walkers

customer_reviews.title: It will do the job...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It is a less expensive version of a box cutter but, it does get the job done and remains durable. I just ran out of blades, then it was lost. Darn. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. As expected. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Works well. Easy to change with a screwdriver. I don't mind having to use a screwdriver so it isn't a conern for me. The blade action is very nice and the tool holds the blade solidly. This is very solidly made. I would buy again if this one would ever break (which is unlikely unless it is driven over with the car).
customer_reviews.author: skotko

customer_reviews.title: Do. Not. Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Item sucks do not buy this one especially because if it’s defective you can return it. Which most of them are. Read your reviews first. Awful experience and can’t even get a refund. Terrible product
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put together
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but this is so unnecessarily complex to setup. And the fact that you’re handling a razor blade and need to perfectly tuck the sharp blade into a cheap lever leaves you on edge. And the spare razor blades that move inside make my stomach turn that it’s going to fall apart
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Delivered broken
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I grabbed it, I could hear some rattling. I tried to extend the blade...and well it didn't extend, as you can see in the picture. I tried to unscrew the two sides so I could go in and fix it, and the screw was impossible to remove. I went to their website to contact HR, filled out the form, clicked Submit...and got an error. So screw it, I'll leave a review instead. It's only 5 bucks, but I'd spend that five spot elsewhere if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Hashem S.

customer_reviews.title: I decided to go for a name brand and am glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I've bought cheap ones before and they were always sticky. I decided to go for a name brand and am glad I did. It's easy to use, feels solid and I like to use it. I had a workman here who needed it and after he left, I couldn't find it. Thinking he took it by mistake, I ordered another one. I use it for something every day. Needless to say, I came across my lost box cutter. Now I have 2 and put them at opposite ends of the house.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Ok tool.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well throughout my move...packing and unpacking. A little shaky since the screws didn't seem to go all the way in. But adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Utility knife
customer_reviews.text: Replaced one I had for many years that had rusted. Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Angel

customer_reviews.title: Very great item
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for 30 plus years and have always found it handy to use and very sturdy. I purchased this one to replace a broken utility knife that we had in the kitchen and I am sure thus will be useful for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Lois R.

customer_reviews.title: Opens Amazon Packages Just How I Want
customer_reviews.text: I legitimately purchased this from Amazon with the sole purpose to open future amazon packages. Its remained sharp and useful to doing just that.
customer_reviews.author: LittleByrdEee

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I already have one. I just needed another one for an extra tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Sully  G.

customer_reviews.title: Screw was stuck, I was only able to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Screw was stuck, I was only able to get it move a 1/4 turn, so I couldn't open it to put a blade in (not included?) The switch in the back felt cheap and loose.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I can't unscrew it to access the blade, so I can't use it. It seems cheaper than the ones I've owned previously.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J.

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut through a thick plastic deck box to turn into a giant catbox. Wasn't easy, but it got the job done in the absence of a band saw. EXTREMELY sturdy design, was not afraid of the blade or body of the knife breaking at all despite applying substantial force to the plastic as I was cutting. I could probably run this over with a car and have it work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenmoon

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: We got the box cutter but could not remove the screw to get the blades out. Disappointed that we are not able to use it right away. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: MariaBrisia Cornejo

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, high quality. I use this for working with miniatures. It's great for trimming balsa wood. Stanley is a brand I trust.
customer_reviews.author: TheCatLady

customer_reviews.title: Some assembly
customer_reviews.text: Not ready to use, you need to open utility knife and assemble to get blade in retractable setting. fine for me, not for the ones I ordered for that didn't know this and thought they had to order blades for it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Provost

customer_reviews.title: The absolute worst
customer_reviews.text: Included in the package were three rusty blades. This product is garbage. Since it only cost me $5, I didn't even bother to return.
customer_reviews.author: indiefilm

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality control—threads of cover screw are bad. A utility knife that is difficult to open/close has little utility.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Portman

product_meta.title: Stanley 10-099 6 in Classic 99® Retractable Utility Knife, 1-Pack
product_meta.description:
680-10-099 This item features: -Multi-position blade slide. -Blade storage in handle. -Top and bottom overlap nose holds blade securely. -Blade Shape: Straight-Edged. -Blade Material: Steel. -Handle Length: 6 in. -Handle Type: Straight. -Handle Material: Die-Cast Metal. -Includes: (3) 11-921 Blades. -Type: Retractable Blade Knife. -Quantity: 6 per box. -Price is for 1 Each. Amazon.com The Stanley 6-Inch Classic 99 Retractable Utility Knife starts sharper and stays sharper than standard heavy-duty blades. This knife features a patented interlocking nose to hold the blade securely. The three-position, retractable blade can be stored in the handle. This knife includes three blades and comes with Stanley's limited lifetime warranty. Everyone knows the importance of the right tool for the job. Stanley's Application Specific Blades are designed with unique features for cutting drywall, roofing shingles and paper. Each blade is constructed of carbon alloy steel. With Stanley's patented S3 Technology, paper blades start sharper and stay sharper, roofing blades are stronger, and drywall and paper blades deliver more cuts per blade. The entire line provides better performance than standard heavy duty blades. View the comparison chart to choose the Stanley blade that is right for you.

AMAZON.COM
The Stanley 6-Inch Classic 99 Retractable Utility Knife starts sharper and stays sharper than standard heavy-duty blades. This knife features a patented interlocking nose to hold the blade securely. The three-position, retractable blade can be stored in the handle. This knife includes three blades and comes with Stanley's limited lifetime warranty.

 Everyone knows the importance of the right tool for the job. Stanley's "Application Specific Blades" are designed with unique features for cutting drywall, roofing shingles and paper. Each blade is constructed of carbon alloy steel. With Stanley's patented S3 Technology, paper blades start sharper and stay sharper, roofing blades are stronger, and drywall and paper blades deliver more cuts per blade. The entire line provides better performance than standard heavy duty blades. View the comparison chart to choose the Stanley blade that is right for you.
feature_bullets: Interlocking nose to hold blade securely
Blade storage in handle,Blade is stored inside the the body of the knife.
Includes three 11-921 Heavy Duty utility blades
Starts sharper and stays sharper than standard heavy-duty blades
3-position, retractable blade; blade storage in handle
Patented interlocking nose holds blade securely

specifications.Warranty Description: Limited Lifetime Warranty: Stanley warrants this product to the original purchaser for its useful life against deficiencies in material and workmanship.
